item.title: 美国巴士公司 Coach 申请破产以出售业务
item.description: 周二晚些时候，Megabus 和美国及加拿大其他通勤巴士线路的运营商 Coach USA 在特拉华州申请破产保护，寻求出售资产并摆脱 2019 年不合时宜的私募股权收购所带来的债务。【原文：Coach USA, the operator of Megabus and other commuter bus lines in the U.S. and Canada, filed for bankruptcy protection in Delaware late Tuesday, seeking to sell its assets and shed debt incurred in an ill-timed 2019 private equity buyout.】

item.title: 西南航空首席执行官不会辞职，将考虑激进投资者埃利奥特的意见
item.description: 西南航空公司首席执行官鲍勃-乔丹（Bob Jordan）周三表示，他不会辞职，因为该航空公司面临着激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）的压力，已经在考虑修改其开放座位政策和其他可能的变化。【原文：Southwest Airlines CEO Bob Jordan said on Wednesday he will not resign as the air carrier faces pressure from activist investor Elliott Investment Management, with it already considering amendments to its open-seating policy and other potential changes.】

item.title: 埃尼集团首席执行官表示，Plenitude 公司已准备好在市场条件成熟时上市
item.description: 意大利能源公司埃尼（Eni）旗下的零售和可再生能源业务公司 Plenitude 首席执行官斯特凡诺-戈贝蒂（Stefano Goberti）周三表示，一旦市场条件允许，该公司准备在米兰证券交易所上市。【原文：Plenitude, the retail and renewable business of Italian energy company Eni , is ready to list on the Milan bourse as soon as market conditions allow it, its Chief Executive Stefano Goberti said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 卡特彼勒将回购规模扩大 200 亿美元，并上调股息
item.description: 卡特彼勒公司周三表示，已将季度股息上调 8%，并将股票回购授权上调 200 亿美元，公司股价在早盘交易中上涨 2%。【原文：Caterpillar has raised its quarterly dividend by 8% and its share repurchase authorization by $20 billion, the company said on Wednesday, sending its shares up 2% in morning trading.】

item.title: 美国法院驳回禁止亚马逊解雇支持工会工人的命令
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周三驳回了法官要求亚马逊公司在全国范围内的仓库组织活动中不得解雇工会支持者的命令。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday tossed out a judge's order that required Amazon.com to refrain from firing union supporters amid a nationwide organizing campaign at its warehouses.】

item.title: 派拉蒙交易谈判让好莱坞顶级电影公司成为焦点
item.description: 熟悉谈判情况的消息人士称，媒体女继承人莎莉-雷德斯通（Shari Redstone）周二突然终止了与大卫-埃利森（David Ellison）领导的 Skydance Media 的谈判，从而扼杀了向这家独立制片厂出售派拉蒙全球公司控股权的可能性。【原文：Media heiress Shari Redstone abruptly ended talks with David Ellison-led Skydance Media on Tuesday, killing the potential sale of a controlling stake in Paramount Global to the independent studio, sources familiar with the talks said.】

item.title: YouTube批评者要求美国调查视频网站的 "客厅主导地位
item.description: 技术和竞争监督组织呼吁美国司法部调查YouTube，称该视频流平台可能使谷歌及其母公司Alphabet主宰家庭娱乐。【原文：Tech and competition watchdog groups have called on the U.S. Department of Justice to probe YouTube, saying the video-streaming platform could enable Google and its parent company, Alphabet , to dominate home entertainment.】

item.title: 苹果超越微软重返全球最有价值公司宝座
item.description: 周三，苹果公司再次成为全球最有价值的公司，将微软从榜首位置上赶了下来，因为这家 iPhone 制造商在主导人工智能技术的竞争中一路领先。【原文：Apple once again became the world's most valuable company on Wednesday, dethroning Microsoft from the top spot, as the iPhone maker pushed ahead in a race to dominate artificial intelligence technology.】

item.title: 淘金热将持续到 2024 年，但 3000 美元大关可能难以实现
item.description: 交易商和业内专家表示，黄金连续创下历史新高的闪电式涨势在2024年下半年仍有继续的迹象，因为金银的基本面依然稳固，尽管每盎司3,000美元看起来遥不可及。【原文：Gold's lightning rally to successive record highs shows every sign of continuing in the second half of 2024 as the fundamental case for bullion remains firmly in place, though $3,000 per ounce looks just out of reach, traders and industry experts said.】

item.title: 通胀数据公布后，美联储有望在 9 月降息
item.description: 美国政府的一份报告显示，5 月份消费者价格没有出现任何上涨，这可能为未来几个月的降息铺平道路。【原文：Federal Reserve policymakers may feel more confident that inflation is back on a downward path after a U.S. government report showed consumer prices did not rise at all in May, potentially paving the way for interest-rate cuts in coming months.】

item.title: Citron Research 关闭 GameStop 空仓
item.description: 香橼研究公司（Citron Research）周三在 X.com 上表示，在看跌 GameStop 公司几天后，该公司不再持有零售交易商最喜爱的 GameStop 的空头头寸。【原文：Citron Research no longer has a short position in retail traders' favorite GameStop , the short seller said on X.com on Wednesday, days after taking a bearish position in the company.】

item.title: 调查显示：人工智能和大选风险逼近，美国企业主寻求更高的保险额度
item.description: 保险经纪公司盖拉格（Gallagher）周三的一项调查显示，人工智能和美国大选已成为今年企业面临的重大风险，80%的企业主担心他们的保险无法承保特定损失。【原文：Artificial intelligence and U.S. election have emerged as significant risks to businesses this year with an overwhelming 80% of owners worried their insurance will not cover a specific loss, a survey by insurance brokerage Gallagher showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 佛罗里达州养老金委员会支持特斯拉首席执行官马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案
item.description: 佛罗里达州养老金委员会投票支持特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）在该公司即将召开的年度会议上提出的 560 亿美元薪酬方案，称该计划 "表现出非常高的绩效薪酬水平"。【原文：Florida's pension board voted in support of the $56 billion pay package of Tesla CEO Elon Musk for the company's upcoming annual meeting, saying the plan "exhibits very high levels of pay-for-performance."】

item.title: 特斯拉因涉嫌非法电气工程被瑞典警方通报
item.description: 瑞典电工工会（Swedish Electricians' Union）周三表示，美国电动汽车制造商特斯拉（Tesla）已向瑞典警方报案，被指控在未进行必要注册的情况下从事电气安装工作。【原文：U.S. electric vehicle manufacturer Tesla has been reported to police in Sweden accused of performing electrical installation work without the necessary registration, the Swedish Electricians' Union said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 5 月 CPI 持平增强美联储抑制通胀的信心
item.description: 由于汽油价格降低，美国 5 月份消费者物价指数意外持平，但通胀率可能仍然过高，美联储可能无法在 9 月份之前开始降息，因为美联储将于周三晚些时候结束政策例会。【原文：The U.S. Consumer Price Index was unexpectedly unchanged in May amid cheaper gasoline, but inflation likely remains too high for the Federal Reserve, which concludes it regular policy meeting later on Wednesday, to start cutting interest rates before September.】

item.title: 美国 5 月居民消费价格持平，低于预期的微幅上涨
item.description: 由于汽油价格降低，5 月份美国消费者价格意外持平，但通胀率可能仍然过高，在劳动力市场持续强劲的背景下，美联储可能无法在 9 月份之前开始降息。【原文：U.S. consumer prices were unexpectedly unchanged in May amid cheaper gasoline, but inflation likely remains too high for the Federal Reserve to start cutting interest rates before September against the backdrop of a persistently strong labor market.】

item.title: 中国央行推动再贷款加快存量房销售
item.description: 由于房地产危机威胁到世界第二大经济体的经济增长，中国央行周三召开会议，推动为保障性住房提供金融支持，以加快未售出住房的销售。【原文：China's central bank on Wednesday held a meeting to promote its financial support for affordable housing in a bid to accelerate sales of unsold housing stock, as a property crisis threatens growth in the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 电动汽车初创企业菲斯科遭遇最新挫折，将召回 1.8 万辆汽车
item.description: 菲斯科周三表示，由于软件故障和不符合安全标准，公司将在北美和欧洲召回18000多辆汽车，这是这家资金短缺的电动汽车初创公司遭遇的最新挫折。【原文：Fisker said on Wednesday it was recalling more than 18,000 cars in North America and Europe due to faulty software and non-compliance with safety standards, in the latest setback for the cash-strapped electric-vehicle startup.】

item.title: 怡安集团、开发金融公司提供 3.5 亿美元的乌克兰战争保险
item.description: 怡安保险经纪公司（Aon）和美国国际开发金融公司（U.S. International Development Finance Corporation）周三表示，将为乌克兰提供一项价值 3.5 亿美元的战争保险计划，以帮助资本投资和经济复苏。【原文：Insurance broker Aon and the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation are offering a $350 million war insurance programme for Ukraine to aid capital investment and economic recovery, Aon said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，欧盟提议制裁俄罗斯航运巨头 Sovcomflot 公司
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引其看到的一份文件报道，欧盟正提议制裁俄罗斯石油运输巨头 Sovcomflot PJSC，以限制克里姆林宫为其对乌克兰的战争提供资金的能力。【原文：The European Union is proposing to sanction Russia's oil-shipping giant Sovcomflot PJSC in a move to limit the Kremlin's ability to finance its war against Ukraine, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing a document seen by it.】

item.title: 联邦快递将在欧洲裁减多达 2000 个后台职位
item.description: 联邦快递（FedEx）在周三提交的一份文件中称，该公司正计划在欧洲裁减1700至2000个后台职位，因为这家包裹递送公司正努力应对疲软的货运需求。【原文：FedEx is planning to cut between 1,700 and 2,000 back-office jobs in Europe, it said in a filing on Wednesday, as the parcel delivery company struggles with weak freight demand.】

item.title: 派拉蒙的莎莉-雷德斯通搁置与 Skydance 的潜在合并交易
item.description: 派拉蒙全球公司的大股东莎莉-雷德斯通（Shari Redstone）突然终止了与大卫-埃里森（David Ellison）的制片公司 Skydance Media 的潜在合并谈判，这实际上扼杀了酝酿数月之久的交易。【原文：Paramount Global's majority shareholder Shari Redstone has abruptly ended talks for a potential merger with David Ellison's production company Skydance Media, effectively killing the deal that was in the works for several months.】

item.title: 福特计划在西班牙巴伦西亚工厂裁员多达 1,600 人
item.description: 美国汽车制造商福特公司周三表示，继去年宣布裁员1100人之后，该公司计划在其位于西班牙巴伦西亚的装配厂再裁员1600人。【原文：U.S. car maker Ford said on Wednesday it plans to cut a further up to 1,600 jobs at its assembly plant in Valencia, Spain, after announcing a reduction of 1,100 staff last year.】

item.title: 在通胀数据和美联储展望公布之前，期货市场步履维艰
item.description: 由于投资者在等待一份重要的通胀报告和美联储政策会议的结束，周三美国股指期货交易持平或小幅上涨。【原文：U.S. stock index futures traded flat to slightly higher on Wednesday, as investors awaited a crucial inflation report and the conclusion of the Federal Reserve's policy meeting.】

item.title: 美联储有望维持利率稳定，预计 2024 年减息次数减少
item.description: 预计美联储将在周三维持利率不变，美国央行决策者的新经济预测可能会显示今年的降息次数减少，货币政策放松的启动时间推迟。【原文：The Federal Reserve is expected to leave interest rates unchanged on Wednesday, with new economic projections from the U.S. central bank's policymakers likely to show fewer rate cuts this year and a delayed start to monetary policy easing.】

item.title: 阿根廷经济快照：央行美元购买狂潮放缓
item.description: 阿根廷央行已开始为积极购买美元踩刹车，这是在新任自由派总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）领导下建立储备的关键举措，分析人士认为这与当地农民谷物销售低于预期有关。【原文：Argentina's central bank has started to put the brakes on its aggressive buying of dollars, a key push to build up reserves under new libertarian President Javier Milei, something analysts pegged to weaker-than-expected sales of grains by local farmers.】

item.title: 空中客车公司寻求强制周末加班，以赶上延迟的 A220 生产
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士告诉路透社，空中客车公司已告知蒙特利尔地区 A220 工厂的工人，该公司希望在周末强制加班，以赶上亏损喷气机的延迟生产。【原文：Airbus has told workers at its Montreal-area A220 factory that it wants to impose mandatory overtime on weekends to catch up on delayed production of the money-losing jet, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国 这波反弹能否对抗美联储？
item.description: 市场通讯员 Naomi Rovnick 对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by markets correspondent Naomi Rovnick】

item.title: Kantar 称苹果成为首个价值 1 万亿美元的全球品牌
item.description: Kantar's BrandZ 周三公布的全球品牌价值排名显示，美国科技公司苹果成为首个品牌价值突破 1 万亿美元的品牌，比去年增长了 15%。【原文：U.S. technology firm Apple has become the first brand to cross $1 trillion in brand value, a 15% jump from last year, a global ranking by Kantar's BrandZ showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国政府取消关税后，澳大利亚葡萄酒对华出口激增
item.description: 澳大利亚贸易部长周三表示，在中国政府取消关税后的一个月内，澳大利亚葡萄酒制造商向中国运送了价值8600万澳元（约合5700万美元）的葡萄酒。【原文：Australian wine makers shipped wine worth A$86 million ($57 million) to China in the month after Beijing lifted tariffs and should be confident of bumper sales going forward, the trade minister said on Wednesday.】
